original_data.Title: Authentication & Authorization: OAuth
original_data.Short Intro: Implementing Web Security with OAuth 2.0
original_data.Prequisites: This course was built to expand upon the concepts introduced in Full Stack Foundations, specifically: performing CRUD operationsmaking use of templatesdeveloping with the Flask frameworkAdditionally, HTML, JavaScript, AJAX are heavily used in this course.  A basic understanding of these technologies is needed to get the most out of these lectures.If you'd like to refresh your HTML knowledge start with our Intro to HTML and CSS course. You can check out the JavaScript Basics and Intro to AJAX courses to brush up on these topics as well.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: Intro to Relational Databases
original_data.Short Intro: SQL, DB-API, and More!
original_data.Prequisites:
You can read and write basic code in Python. This course uses programming exercises in Python. If you haven't worked with Python before, check out our course Programming Foundations with Python.
If you can understand this code (maybe with the help of the random module documentation), you know enough Python for this course:
import random

def ChooseTwice(items):
    a = random.choice(items)
    b = random.choice(items)
    return a, b

names = ["Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "Debra"]
(one, two) = ChooseTwice(names)
if one == two:
    print "%s is happy!" % one
else:
    print "%s likes %s!" % (one, two)

You can use a command-line interface (terminal). Some of the exercises in this course involve using a Unix-style command-line interface to enter commands, run Python programs, and navigate directories.
If you have taken our course on Git and Github, the level of command-line use in this course is similar.
You don't need to be a Web programmer. This course does include a small Web application and some HTML and JavaScript in examples, but you will not need to make changes in these languages.
You don't need any previous database experience. This course is an entry-level introduction to relational databases.
You need a programming text editor (such as Sublime Text) installed on your computer. You should be able to use it to open and edit files of Python code.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Data and TablesLearn about how relational databases let you structure data into tables.Learn about the importance of unique keys and relationships between tables.Learn about how relational databases let you structure data into tables.Learn about the importance of unique keys and relationships between tables.Elements of SQLBegin learning SQL, the Structured Query Language used by most relational databases.Learn about the select and insert statements, the basic operations for reading and writing data.Learn about the operators and syntax available to get the database to scan and join tables for you.Begin learning SQL, the Structured Query Language used by most relational databases.Learn about the select and insert statements, the basic operations for reading and writing data.Learn about the operators and syntax available to get the database to scan and join tables for you.Python DB-APILearn how to access a relational database from Python code.Use a virtual machine (VM) to run a Python web application with a database.Common security pitfalls of database applications, including the famous Bobby Tables.Learn how to access a relational database from Python code.Use a virtual machine (VM) to run a Python web application with a database.Common security pitfalls of database applications, including the famous Bobby Tables.Deeper Into SQLLearn how to design and create new databases.Learn about normalized design, which makes it easier to write effective code using a database.Learn how to use the SQL join operators to rapidly connect data from different tables.Learn how to design and create new databases.Learn about normalized design, which makes it easier to write effective code using a database.Learn how to use the SQL join operators to rapidly connect data from different tables.

learning_outcomes: Develop efficient SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data.
Analyze database schemas and identify relationships between tables.
Utilize Python DB-API to interact with relational databases programmatically.
Understand the principles of relational database design and data modeling.
Implement database solutions using Python for web applications.
Apply SQL to create, read, update, and delete data in relational databases.

original_data.Title: Configuring Linux Web Servers
original_data.Short Intro: Your First Ubuntu Server
original_data.Prequisites: You should be comfortable with your terminal and working within a shell, if you need a refresher take a look at our Intro to the Shell.To actually get a web application up and running you should be familiar with the Python programming language and PostgreSQL. Programming Foundations with Python and Intro to Relational Databases can help you get up to speed if you feel you need some additional practice.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: Full Stack Foundations
original_data.Short Intro: Build a data-driven web app with Python
original_data.Prequisites: You should be comfortable with Python, including Object-Oriented Programming. If you’d like to brush up on your Python, try the first three lessons of our Intro to Computer Science course. For Object-Oriented Programming in Python, see Programming Foundations with Python.You should also have a firm understanding of SQL and working with a relational database, particularly PostgreSQL. Our Intro to Relational Databases course can get you started if you feel you’re not yet prepared.Finally, you should be able to read and write HTML and CSS without any guidance. If you need a refresher on HTML and CSS, start with our Intro to HTML and CSS course.To complete the final project for this course, it is critical you meet these prerequisites as you are given no assets to begin with and will truly build a complete web application from scratch.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: Introduction to Python Programming
original_data.Short Intro: Learn to solve practical problems with Python.

See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: HTTP & Web Servers
original_data.Short Intro: How does HTTP work?
original_data.Prequisites: This course is intended for students with a working knowledge of Python, HTML, and the Unix shell. A Mac, Windows, or Linux computer is required.In this course, you will run commands on your computer using a Unix-like shell environment (command line). A basic familiarity with the terminal, working with files and command-line programs, and the git version control software will be very useful.You will read and write object-oriented Python code using a text editor, and will read Python module documentation to learn about new modules. You will also write code that sends HTML to browsers, so a basic knowledge of HTML markup will come in handy. CSS and JavaScript are not required.This course does not use a virtual machine (VM). You will be installing and writing software on your own computer. You will need a text editor and the ability to install software.Elements of this course require communicating with web services including Github and Heroku.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Requests & ResponsesExplore HTTP by running a web server on your own computerInteract with servers and browsers from the command lineDiscover HTTP requests and responses, headers, status codes, and other features of the protocolExplore HTTP by running a web server on your own computerInteract with servers and browsers from the command lineDiscover HTTP requests and responses, headers, status codes, and other features of the protocolThe Web from PythonWrite code that speaks HTTP both as a server and a clientBuild Python code that accepts HTML form submissions, accesses web services, and constructs formatted responsesWrite code that speaks HTTP both as a server and a clientBuild Python code that accepts HTML form submissions, accesses web services, and constructs formatted responsesHTTP in the Real WorldConnect your knowledge of HTTP basics with the rest of the worldDeploy services you've written so that other people can see themInvestigate web server capacity, cookies, security, and new developments in the protocolConnect your knowledge of HTTP basics with the rest of the worldDeploy services you've written so that other people can see themInvestigate web server capacity, cookies, security, and new developments in the protocol

original_data.Title: Artificial Intelligence for Trading
original_data.Short Intro: Complete real-world projects designed by industry experts, covering topics from asset management to trading signal generation. Master AI algorithms for trading, and build your career-ready portfolio.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the basics of quantitative analysis, including data processing, trading signal generation, and portfolio management. Use Python to work with historical stock data, develop trading strategies, and construct a multi-factor model with optimization.

unified_data.description: Complete real-world projects designed by industry experts, covering topics from asset management to trading signal generation. Master AI algorithms for trading, and build your career-ready portfolio.

Manage a portfolio using AI-driven techniques.

original_data.Title: Intro to Machine Learning with TensorFlow
original_data.Short Intro: Learn foundational machine learning techniques - from data manipulation to unsupervised and supervised algorithms.
original_data.Courses: Intro to Machine Learning with TensorFlow
original_data.Prequisites: To optimize your chances of success in this program, we recommend intermediate Python programming knowledge and basic knowledge of probability and statistics.
original_data.What you learn:
Learn foundational machine learning algorithms, starting with data cleaning and supervised models. Then, move on to exploring deep and unsupervised learning. At each step, get practical experience by applying your skills to code exercises and projects.
This program is intended for students with experience in Python, who have not yet studied Machine Learning topics.

unified_data.title: Intro to Machine Learning with TensorFlow
unified_data.description: Learn foundational machine learning techniques - from data manipulation to unsupervised and supervised algorithms.
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamentals of machine learning
Apply Python and TensorFlow to implement machine learning algorithms
Perform data cleaning and preprocessing techniques
Implement and evaluate unsupervised learning models
Implement and evaluate supervised learning models
Apply deep learning techniques to solve real-world problems

original_data.Title: Data Wrangling
original_data.Short Intro: Learn the most efficient methods for gathering raw “dirty” data and cleaning it up for analysis. After finishing this course, you’ll be able to gather messy data from a variety of sources and “tidy” it up in no time using the powerful Python library, pandas.
original_data.Prequisites: Python & SQL.
original_data.What you learn: Knowing how to “wrangle data” (aka write code that cleans up “dirty” data and shapes it into useful formats) is a universally sought-after skill across data-driven companies. In this course you’ll learn how to leverage the power of Python to quickly gather, assess & clean messy data so it can be explored and analyzed easily.

unified_data.title: Data Wrangling
unified_data.description: Learn the most efficient methods for gathering raw dirty data and cleaning it up for analysis. After finishing this course, youll be able to gather messy data from a variety of sources and tidy it up in no time using the powerful Python library, pandas.
learning_outcomes: Implement efficient data cleaning workflows.
Apply data wrangling techniques to prepare data for analysis.
Clean and transform messy data into a usable format using Pandas.
Assess data quality and identify common data issues.
Gather data from various sources using Python.

original_data.Title: Data Visualization with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Discover how data visualization can communicate insights far more effectively than text or tables. In this course, you’ll learn how to build data visualizations programmatically using Python, and how you can use visualization to both discover and convey trends in your data.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic Python skill, statistics and probability concepts.
original_data.What you learn: Data visualization allows us to instantly see patterns in data that would otherwise be impossible to detect. Without visualization, humans would be unable to make sense of even small amounts of data, let alone the trillions of megabytes now generated every day. In this course, you’ll learn how to create illuminating charts of your data analyses, so you can convey findings to others in the most impactful way possible.

unified_data.title: Data Visualization with Python
unified_data.description: Discover how data visualization can communicate insights far more effectively than text or tables. In this course, youll learn how to build data visualizations programmatically using Python, and how you can use visualization to both discover and convey trends in your data.
learning_outcomes: Evaluate the appropriateness of different visualization methods for specific data analysis tasks
Apply data visualization techniques to identify patterns and trends in datasets
Design effective visualizations for different types of data and analytical goals
Customize visualizations to enhance clarity and impact
Communicate data insights effectively through visual representations
Create compelling data visualizations using Python libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn

original_data.Title: AWS Machine Learning Foundations Course
original_data.Prequisites: All learners are welcome to take the foundations course, but familiarity with basic mathematical concepts such as calculation, average, variance, and beginning level programming (preferably Python) is recommended to fully engage in all of the coursework. If you want to brush up on your Python skills, we encourage you to review our free Introduction to Python course.We encourage you to dive deeper in to machine learning with our Intro to Machine Learning and Intro to Deep Learning with PyTorch courses.You may also find our Version Control with Git course helpful.  It is also offered for free.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: Real-Time Analytics with Apache Storm
original_data.Short Intro: The "Hadoop of Real-Time"
original_data.Prequisites: Programming language required: JavaTo be successful, you'll need intermediate knowledge of Java. Specifically, this is defined by experience and comfort with Java syntax, compile & run-time error diagnostics and debugging, ability to use javadocs as needed, and intermediate data structures including Arrays, HashMaps, and LinkedLists.  If you need to build these skills, a good starting point is Udacity’s Introduction to Java with additional comfortability needed identifying and debugging compile & run-time errors.No prior experience is assumed in Ubuntu, git, Maven, Redis, Flask (Python) or d3 (Javascript).  Python is useful, but optional.  A basic course such as CS101 or OO in Python would be helpful.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: Introduction to Machine Learning Course
original_data.Short Intro: Pattern Recognition for Fun and Profit
original_data.Prequisites:
To succeed in this course, you must be proficient at programming in Python and basic statistics. If you need a refresher on any of these topics, you can check out these courses:

Intro to Python Programming
Inferential Statistics
Descriptive Statistics

  One additional course that would be nice to have is Intro to Data Science, as this will get you familiar with scientific problem-solving.  However, completion of that class isn't required for success.  We will also use a tiny bit of git, which you can also learn about on Udacity.One thing that we don’t require is previous exposure to machine learning.  If you’re a machine learning beginner, you’re in the right place.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

unified_data.title: Introduction to Machine Learning Course
unified_data.description: Pattern Recognition for Fun and Profit
learning_outcomes: Understand the principles of Machine Learning and its applications
Implement data splitting techniques for training and testing datasets
Apply Naive Bayes classifiers using scikit-learn
Calculate prior and posterior probabilities for simple distributions
Evaluate and select appropriate kernels for SVM models
Implement Support Vector Machine (SVM) classifiers using scikit-learn

original_data.Title: Learn to Code
original_data.Short Intro: Udacity's Intro to Programming is your first step towards careers in Web and App Development, Machine Learning, Data Science, AI, and more! This program is perfect for beginners.
original_data.Prequisites: In order to succeed, we recommend having experience using the web, being able to perform a search on Google, and (most importantly) the determination to keep pushing forward!
original_data.What you learn: Learn the basics of programming through HTML, CSS, Python, and JavaScript. Get extensive practice with hands-on exercises and projects that demonstrate your grasp of coding fundamentals, and build confidence in your ability to think and problem-solve like a programmer.

unified_data.title: Learn to Code
unified_data.description: Udacitys Intro to Programming is your first step towards careers in Web and App Development, Machine Learning, Data Science, AI, and more! This program is perfect for beginners.
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamentals of programming concepts
Build projects that demonstrate coding fundamentals
Develop interactive web applications using JavaScript
Apply HTML and CSS to structure and style web pages
Write Python code to solve basic programming problems
Develop problem-solving skills using computational thinking

Get extensive practice with hands-on exercises and projects that demonstrate your grasp of coding fundamentals, and build confidence in your ability to think and problem-solve like a programmer.

Understand the fundamentals of programming concepts
Implement basic JavaScript for interactive web elements
Utilize Python to solve programming problems

original_data.Title: Introduction to Python
original_data.Short Intro: Every programmer needs to know Python, including those looking to work in rapidly-growing fields such as machine learning and A.I. During this course, you’ll learn the fundamentals you need to take the next step in your career.
original_data.Prequisites: No Experience Required.
original_data.What you learn: In this course, you’ll learn to represent and store data using Python data types and variables, and use conditionals and loops to control the flow of your programs. You’ll harness the power of complex data structures like lists, sets, dictionaries and tuples to store collections of related data. You’ll define and document your own custom functions, write scripts and handle errors. You will also learn to use two powerful Python libraries — Numpy, a scientific computing package, and Pandas, a data manipulation package.

unified_data.title: Introduction to Python
unified_data.description: Every programmer needs to know Python, including those looking to work in rapidly-growing fields such as machine learning and A.I. During this course, youll learn the fundamentals you need to take the next step in your career.
learning_outcomes: Represent and store data using Python data types and variables
Apply Pandas for data manipulation and analysis
Control program flow using conditionals and loops in Python
Apply Numpy for scientific computing tasks
Define and document custom functions in Python
Utilize lists, sets, dictionaries, and tuples to manage data collections

original_data.Title: AI Programming with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Learn Python, NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, PyTorch, Calculus, and Linear Algebra—the foundations for building your own neural network.
original_data.Prequisites: Formal prerequisites include basic knowledge of algebra, and basic programming in any language.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the essential foundations of AI: the programming tools (Python, NumPy, PyTorch), the math (calculus and linear algebra), and the key techniques of neural networks (gradient descent and backpropagation).

unified_data.title: AI Programming with Python
unified_data.description: Learn Python, NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, PyTorch, Calculus, and Linear Algebrathe foundations for building your own neural network.
learning_outcomes: Implement neural networks using PyTorch
Understand gradient descent and backpropagation algorithms
Create data visualizations using Matplotlib
Apply calculus and linear algebra concepts to machine learning problems
Apply NumPy and Pandas for data manipulation and analysis
Understand the fundamentals of Python programming for AI development

original_data.Title: Intro to Self-Driving Cars
original_data.Short Intro: This introductory program is the perfect way to start your journey.
original_data.Prequisites: You should be comfortable reading and modifying code. You should also be comfortable with basic algebra.
original_data.What you learn: In this program, you’ll sharpen your Python skills, apply C++, apply matrices and calculus in code, and touch on computer vision and machine learning. These concepts will be applied to solving self-driving car problems. At the end, you’ll be ready for our Self-Driving Car Engineer Nanodegree program!

unified_data.title: Intro to Self-Driving Cars
unified_data.description: This introductory program is the perfect way to start your journey.
learning_outcomes: Understand the principles of computer vision for object detection
Utilize matrices and calculus in code for autonomous systems
Understand the fundamentals of self-driving car technology
Apply Python and C++ to solve engineering problems
Apply machine learning techniques to self-driving car challenges

original_data.Title: Intro to Machine Learning with PyTorch
original_data.Short Intro: Learn foundational machine learning techniques -- from data manipulation to unsupervised and supervised algorithms.
original_data.Courses: Intro to Machine Learning with PyTorch
original_data.Prequisites: To optimize your chances of success in this program, we recommend intermediate Python programming knowledge and basic knowledge of probability and statistics.
original_data.What you learn:
Learn foundational machine learning algorithms, starting with data cleaning and supervised models. Then, move on to exploring deep and unsupervised learning. At each step, get practical experience by applying your skills to code exercises and projects.
This program is intended for students with experience in Python, who have not yet studied Machine Learning topics.

unified_data.title: Intro to Machine Learning with PyTorch
unified_data.description: Learn foundational machine learning techniques -- from data manipulation to unsupervised and supervised algorithms.
learning_outcomes: Understand the principles of deep learning.
Apply Python and PyTorch for machine learning tasks.
Implement and evaluate supervised learning algorithms.
Design and build machine learning projects.
Clean and prepare data for machine learning models.
Implement and evaluate unsupervised learning algorithms.

original_data.Title: Programming for Data Science with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Prepare for a data science career by learning the fundamental data programming tools: Python, SQL, command line, and git.
original_data.Courses: Learn to Code in Python and SQL
original_data.Prequisites: There are no prerequisites for this program, aside from basic computer skills.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the programming fundamentals required for a career in data science. By the end of the program, you will be able to use Python, SQL, Command Line, and Git.

unified_data.title: Programming for Data Science with Python
unified_data.description: Prepare for a data science career by learning the fundamental data programming tools: Python, SQL, command line, and git.
learning_outcomes: Employ command-line tools for efficient file management and system navigation.
Use Git for version control and collaborative software development.
Understand fundamental data programming concepts.
Manage and manipulate data using Python libraries.
Apply Python programming skills to solve data-related problems.
Utilize SQL to query and manipulate data in relational databases.

original_data.Title: Learn Intermediate Python
original_data.Short Intro: Gain practitioner-level skills with Python and learn the language powering transformation in Data Science, Machine Learning, and beyond.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic familiarity with programming in Python.
original_data.What you learn: Python is a general-purpose coding language with applications in web development, data science, machine learning, fintech and more. The Intermediate Python Nanodegree program equips you to leverage the capabilities of Python and streamline the functionality of applications that perform complex tasks, such as classifying files, data mining a webpage, etc. By the end of the program, you’ll have a portfolio that demonstrates your ability to apply practicioner-level Python skills on the job.

unified_data.title: Learn Intermediate Python
unified_data.description: Gain practitioner-level skills with Python and learn the language powering transformation in Data Science, Machine Learning, and beyond.
learning_outcomes: Implement data mining techniques using Python.
Design and build a portfolio demonstrating practitioner-level Python skills.
Develop applications for file classification.
Leverage Python capabilities for complex tasks.
Apply Python to streamline the functionality of applications.
